page.title: 19LANGHAM POTTERY
page.content:
{LANGHAM POTTERY.
The pottery is run by Mrs Williamson and Mrs Pawsey. It is housed in two wooden sheds about 40 years old and opened 4 years ago. About 50 pots are made each day. They are decorated blue, brown, white and yellow. Some are ovenproof, others range from piggy banks to plates and vases. They use buff clay to make their mugs, pots and plates. A mug with your name on it will cost Â£1.75. They use an electric wheel and the kiln heats to 1260c and is on for 14 hours. They give lessons in the craft of pottery and are about to employ an experienced craftsman on a part time basis, now their business is expanding.
